title: Certified and decertified officers

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Certified and decertified officers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) A copy of the database of all WA certified law enforcement officers, as of April 1, 2023.
2) A copy of the database of all WA DE-certified law enforcement officers, as of April 1, 2023.

These database extracts should include the following fields:
ID
FIRSTNAME
LASTNAME
FULLNAME
AGENCY
STUDENT ID
STATUS
RANK
HIRE DATE
COMMENTS
CREATED DATE
CREATED BY
MODIFIED DATE
MODIFIED BY
CERTIFICATION DATE
CERTIFICATION TYPE

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Texas Department Of Public Safety Documents Related to Surveillance of Black Lives Matter and Related Groups

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Department Of Public Safety Documents Related to Surveillance of Black Lives Matter and Related Groups
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to documents held by the Texas Department of Public Safety related to their surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter and other related groups. In order to ensure a comprehensive search for responsive records, I am also requesting an interagency search for any records that may be held by other law enforcement agencies or government entities.

I want to emphasize that I do not consent to the withholding, deletion, or redaction of any responsive records or documents, except in cases where the Texas Department of Public Safety can provide a specific justification for why the records are exempt from disclosure under the Texas Public Information Act. Please provide me with any non-exempt records or documents in their entirety, including any segregable portions that may be released.

Furthermore, I hereby provide notice that any attempt to withhold, redact, or delete responsive records or documents without providing a specific justification for why they are exempt from disclosure will be met with a complaint and legal action to compel the Texas Department of Public Safety to provide access to the requested records in accordance with the Texas Public Information Act.

In support of this request, I would like to reference local case law and state case law that affirm the public's right to access government records under the Texas Public Information Act. Specifically, local case law includes the Dallas Morning News v. City of Dallas, 281 S.W.3d 708 (Tex. App. – Dallas 2009, no pet.), which held that a government entity cannot withhold requested information unless it can demonstrate that the information falls within a specific exception under the Texas Public Information Act. State case law includes the Texas Department of Public Safety v. Cox Texas Newspapers, LP, 304 S.W.3d 191 (Tex. App. – Austin 2009, pet. denied), which affirmed the public's right to access government records and held that the Texas Department of Public Safety must release requested information unless it falls within a specific exception under the Texas Public Information Act.

Specifically, I am seeking any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the Texas Department of Public Safety's surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter, including any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to this surveillance or investigation. I am also requesting any communications between the Texas Department of Public Safety and other law enforcement agencies or government entities related to the surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter.

Additionally, I am interested in any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the Texas Department of Public Safety's surveillance or investigation of any groups or individuals associated with Black Lives Matter or involved in activism related to racial justice, police reform, or other related issues. This may include but is not limited to groups such as the Movement for Black Lives, Campaign Zero, and the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP).

Furthermore, I would like to request a key string search for any records or documents related to Black Lives Matter or any other related groups, as well as any communications or activities related to these groups. Additionally, please provide any records or documents related to any specialty units within the Texas Department of Public Safety that may be involved in surveillance or investigation activities related to Black Lives Matter or other related groups.

If any responsive records or documents are exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide me with a justification for each exemption relied upon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Request Letter for FBI Records on Jam Master Jay (Jason Mizell)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request Letter for FBI Records on Jam Master Jay (Jason Mizell)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any records or files held by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) related to Jason William Mizell, who is also known as Jam Master Jay. Mizell was a founding member of the hip-hop group Run-DMC and a pioneer in the music industry. He was tragically killed on October 30, 2002, at his recording studio in Queens, New York. I am referencing an article from Rolling Stone magazine, published on March 4, 2021, titled "Jam Master Jay Alleged Killer Goes to Trial," which provides some background on the investigation into his death and the subsequent trial of his alleged killer.

In accordance with the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), I request that all records be released to me, including any documents, memos, emails, or other materials that reference or relate to Jason William Mizell or his death. Additionally, I request that a key string search be conducted to ensure that all relevant records are provided to me. Specifically, I would like to request that the following key strings be used in the search:

Jam Master Jay
Jason Mizell
Run-DMC
Murder
Homicide
Investigation
Suspect
Arrest
Trial
Evidence
Witness
Statement
Interview
Autopsy
Forensic
Ballistics
Gang
Drug
Criminal
Violence
New York City
I also request any records that may be responsive to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) program.

I would like to remind you that the FOIA reflects a strong presumption in favor of disclosure, and that any exemptions to the Act must be narrowly construed. The Supreme Court has held that the FOIA promotes transparency and accountability in government, and that any exemptions to the Act must be based on specific and narrowly defined grounds. See United States Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989); John Doe Agency v. John Doe Corp., 493 U.S. 146 (1989); and Nat'l Archives & Records Admin. v. Favish, 541 U.S. 157 (2004), among other cases.

Therefore, I would like to give notice that I do not consent to any withholding, redaction, or deletion of records that may be responsive to my request, except in cases where the documents are clearly exempt from disclosure under the FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

•	All correspondences, reports, memos and documents created between 1960 and 1993 that contain the word “vermiculite.”

title: Contracts between NYPD and Citizen

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Contracts between NYPD and Citizen
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer, Pursuant to the New York Public Records Law, Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I hereby request the following records: Any contracts between the New York Police Department and the company Citizen between January 1, 2022 and April 5, 2023. I am requesting these records on behalf of VICE Media, and I ask that they be considered for a fee waiver. If you determine that there will be a fee for fulfilling this request, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. If it is not possible to provide the records within five business days, please let me know when I might expect to receive them. If any portion of my request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial and cite the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Thank you for your assistance in this matter. Sincerely, Jason Koebler

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

title: Request for NYPD Documents and Memos Regarding Press Dealings and Press Credentials

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for NYPD Documents and Memos Regarding Press Dealings and Press Credentials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any documents or memos related to the New York City Police Department's (NYPD) dealings with the press or obtaining press credentials, for the period of January 1, 2022 to the present.

I am specifically interested in any documents or memos that provide guidance or procedures to NYPD officers on how to handle interactions with members of the press, how to verify the authenticity of press credentials, or how to distinguish between legitimate press activity and unlawful activity.

I would like to remind you of the New York State case law that prohibits the deletion, redaction, or withholding of responsive information unless the information is specifically exempted from disclosure under FOIL. In Buffalo News, Inc. v. Buffalo Enterprise Development Corp., 84 N.Y.2d 488, 493 (1994), the court held that "[e]xemptions from disclosure must be narrowly construed, with the burden resting on the agency to demonstrate that the requested material falls squarely within a FOIL exemption." Therefore, I respectfully request that you provide me with a written explanation for any exemption claimed for the requested documents.

Please note that any deletion, redaction, or withholding of information that is not specifically exempted under FOIL will be considered a violation of the law, and I will file a complaint and take legal action to compel the disclosure of the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Communications and Documents Related to Trump Indictment and NYPD Monitoring of Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to the following records for the time period of January 1, 2023 to the present:

All communications (including emails, letters, memos, and text messages) between the New York City Police Department (NYPD) and the Manhattan District Attorney's Office (DANY) related to the preparation and readiness of an indictment against Donald Trump, his associates, or his businesses.

All documents (including intelligence reports, after action reports, and surveillance logs) related to NYPD's monitoring of protests or demonstrations that take place in New York City.

I would like to remind you of the New York State case law that prohibits the deletion, redaction, or withholding of responsive information unless the information is specifically exempted from disclosure under FOIL. In Westchester Rockland Newspapers, Inc. v. Kimball, 50 N.Y.2d 575, 581 (1980), the court held that "[t]he burden rests upon the agency to demonstrate that the material falls squarely within a FOIL exemption by articulating a particularized and specific justification for denying access." Therefore, I respectfully request that you provide me with a written explanation for any exemption claimed for the requested documents.

Please note that any deletion, redaction, or withholding of information that is not specifically exempted under FOIL will be considered a violation of the law, and I will file a complaint and take legal action to compel the disclosure of the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Request for Complaints against Donald J Trump

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Complaints against Donald J Trump
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any and all complaints filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regarding Donald J Trump during his time as a public figure and/or businessperson, on a rolling basis.

Specifically, I am seeking any complaints, filings, or other communications received by the SEC that reference Donald J Trump, his businesses, or his associates. This may include complaints related to securities fraud, insider trading, or any other area over which the SEC has jurisdiction.

I would like to request information on any companies owned or controlled by Donald J Trump, including but not limited to the Trump Organization, Trump Foundation, and Trump International Hotels. Please include any and all relevant communications, documents, or other materials related to complaints filed against these entities or their representatives.

To support my request, I would like to cite several relevant court cases, including SEC v. Trump, 279 F. Supp. 2d 340 (S.D.N.Y. 2003), SEC v. Trump, 2020 WL 4044162 (S.D.N.Y. July 17, 2020), and SEC v. Trump, 2021 WL 1520177 (S.D.N.Y. April 19, 2021). These cases demonstrate the importance of transparency and accountability in the securities industry, and underscore the need for disclosure of relevant complaints and information.

Additionally, I would like to provide notice that any withholding or deletion of responsive records without a lawful basis will result in my pursuit of legal action and complaint to the appropriate authorities. As you are aware, FOIA requires agencies to disclose all non-exempt records in response to a request within a reasonable time frame, and any failure to do so would constitute a violation of the law.

Please provide any responsive records to this request on a rolling basis, as they become available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Communications with Ron DeSantis and Emails from Polksheriff.org Domain

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Communications with Ron DeSantis and Emails from Polksheriff.org Domain
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any communications between the Polk County Sheriff's Office and Ron Desantis, Governor of Florida, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and notes. Additionally, I would like to request any emails sent to or from the domain polksheriff.org, including any recipients in the "To," "From," "CC," or "BCC" fields.

Please provide any responsive records for the last 5 years, dating from April 5, 2018 to April 5, 2023.

As per Florida Public Records Law, agencies are required to provide access to public records unless the records are exempted by law. If any responsive documents contain exempt information, please provide me with the remaining non-exempt portions of the records, and redact or withhold the exempt information.

I would like to remind you that under Florida law, agencies have an obligation to disclose records and not to withhold or redact information that can be reasonably segregated and not subject to exemption. If you withhold or redact any information that should have been released or provide an inadequate response, I will be forced to take legal action and file a complaint in court.

I would like to point out some relevant local court cases to support my request. The Florida Supreme Court in Times Publishing Co. v. City of St. Petersburg, 558 So. 2d 487, 493 (Fla. 1990) held that the Public Records Law must be construed liberally in favor of open access to public records, and that exemptions must be strictly construed.

Moreover, the Florida Fourth District Court of Appeal in State v. City of Deerfield Beach, 426 So. 2d 1332, 1336 (Fla. 4th DCA 1983) emphasized that agencies have a duty to search all of their files for responsive records, and cannot limit their search to only certain files or categories.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to specific records related to communications between Eric Adams, the current Mayor of New York City, and Governor Kathy Hochul. I am requesting any emails, including any email metadata, sent to or from Eric Adams or Governor Hochul, as well as any emails sent to, from, or copied to other individuals or email addresses, such as CC or BCC recipients. I am requesting the following records under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL):

Any and all emails sent to or from Eric Adams and Governor Kathy Hochul from January 1, 2022, to the date of the processing of this request, including any email metadata such as the sender, recipient, date, time, and subject line.

The Office of the Mayor of New York City
The Office of the Governor of New York State

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint. The failure to comply with FOIL is a serious matter and can result in both criminal and civil penalties. Any other written or electronic communication

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint. The failure to comply with FOIL is a serious matter and can result in both criminal and civil penalties. Therefore, I strongly urge you to comply with this request in a timely and complete manner.

Last, I would like to bring to your attention the case law supporting my request:

New York Times Co. v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 756 F.3d 100, 117 (2d Cir. 2014) (holding that "the public has a vital interest in information regarding the operations of its government" and that the FOIA "embodies the basic principle that an informed citizenry is essential to democracy").

Matter of John P. v. Whalen, 54 N.Y.2d 89, 96 (1981) (stating that "FOIL expresses this State's strong commitment to open government and public accountability and imposes a broad duty on government to make its records available to the public").

Please note that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Packaging Labels Rejected by the Cannabis Control Commission

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Packaging Labels Rejected by the Cannabis Control Commission
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Per the Advertising, Labeling, and Packaging regulatory requirements set forth 935 CMR 500.104 (4)-(6), the CCC must pre-approve a package or label. Please provide the following:

-The number of approved products to date since the recreational market opened (June 2018 to present), broken down by category.

-All images/photographs/files and information (as detailed in 935 CMR 500.104 (7)(b)(1)-(2)) pertaining to proposed packaging and/or labels that have been rejected by the CCC since the recreational market opened (June 2018 to present), including the specific reasons for the rejection.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Faraone

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

04/05/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR144225 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013541-040423 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

title: West Virginia Youth Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia Youth Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which incarcerated youth (i.e. juvenile) and/or their parents or legal guardians are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

2) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department/office or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of youths (i.e., juveniles) charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Rhode Island State Employees (2019 - 2022)

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Rhode Island State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Rhode Island Executive Branch from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, date of birth or age, title, job title code, department or agency, race, gender, full-time/part-time status, location, hire date, termination date, civil service or classification status, and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I see that RI makes many of these data available here: http://www.transparency.ri.gov/payroll/. If my request above cannot be filled, I would like to request at minimum a copy of the data available on the transparency site with a variable that denotes whether an employee is in the classified, unclassified, or non-classified service. 

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: Your first record request #23-69 has been opened.
communications.communication:
RI Department of Administration ************************************************************************ Your first RI Department of Administration record request (request number #23-69) has been submitted. It is currently unpublished and is not available for the general public to view. Thank you for your submission. The Department of Administration ("Department") has received your Access to Public Records Act ("APRA") request. The Department will respond formally to your request on or before ten (10) business days from the receipt of your request in accordance with APRA and the Department's APRA regulations, available at https://rules.sos.ri.gov/regulations/part/220-50-05-1. Please note that requests received after business hours are considered received the following business day. Additionally, please note that for voluminous or time-consuming requests or for other good cause, the Department may extend the time to respond for an additional twenty (20) business days and/or may estimate and request prepayment of search and retrieval charges ($15 per hour with the first hour free) before proceeding with the request. title: Mass DCR / Riverbend Park 2023

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Mass DCR / Riverbend Park 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents (including emails, texts, and any other communications) concerning the scheduling of pedestrian and bicycle access to Riverbend Park in Cambridge in 2023, including, but not limited to, documents and communications concerning whether or not to close Memorial Drive/Riverbend Park to vehicular traffic on Saturdays.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Walker

title: Disciplinary Files and Logs of Mayor Eric Adams During his Tenure with the Department (1984-2006)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Disciplinary Files and Logs of Mayor Eric Adams During his Tenure with the Department (1984-2006)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to specific records related to the disciplinary files and logs of now Mayor Eric Adams of New York City during his time with the New York City Police Department. Mayor Adams served with the department from 1984 to 2006. I am requesting the following records under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL):

All records related to disciplinary actions taken against Eric Adams during his time with the New York City Police Department, including disciplinary files and logs.

Any and all records related to changes, edits, and copies of the responsive documents identified in item 1 above.

A list of all individuals who had access to the records identified in items 1 and 2 above during Eric Adams' tenure with the New York City Police Department.

As a member of the public, I have a right to access these records to gain a better understanding of the professional conduct and performance of now Mayor Eric Adams during his time with the New York City Police Department.

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint. The failure to comply with FOIL is a serious matter and can result in both criminal and civil penalties. Therefore, I strongly urge you to comply with this request in a timely and complete manner.

Last, I would like to bring to your attention the case law supporting my request:

New York City Administrative Code Section 14-151 (a) requires the New York Police Department to maintain records of all complaints and allegations of police misconduct, including records of investigations and findings.

New York State Committee on Open Government, Advisory Opinion #2016-4 (2016) states that police body-worn camera footage is presumptively available under FOIL.

Matter of Fappiano v. New York City Police Department, 95 A.D.3d 981 (2d Dep't 2012) held that "FOIL represents a strong policy in favor of open government, and its exemptions must be narrowly construed."

New York Times Co. v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 756 F.3d 100, 117 (2d Cir. 2014) (holding that "the public has a vital interest in information regarding the operations of its government" and that the FOIA "embodies the basic principle that an informed citizenry is essential to democracy").

Matter of DaimlerChrysler Corp. v. Spitzer, 7 N.Y.3d 653, 663 (2006) (stating that "FOIL, like FOIA, reflects a strong policy in favor of open government, and its exemptions must be narrowly construed").

Please note that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

I am writing to request access to specific records related to an incident involving Officers Brian C. Garcia Badge #30586, Timothy J. Burke Badge #3879, and Patrick L. Leone Badge #20045, with case number 201904461, which occurred on January 24, 2019.

I am requesting the following records under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL):

Complaint records filed against Officers Brian C. Garcia, Timothy J. Burke, and Patrick L. Leone related to case number 201904461.

All records and documents related to the investigation of the incident with case number 201904461, including any written reports, witness statements, and evidence collected.

Body-worn camera footage from Officers Brian C. Garcia, Timothy J. Burke, and Patrick L. Leone during the incident with case number 201904461 on January 24, 2019.

I urge you to carefully read and comply with this request, as I believe that the requested records are of significant public interest and concern. The incident involving Officers Brian C. Garcia, Timothy J. Burke, and Patrick L. Leone resulted in a complaint and raised questions about police conduct and use of force. As a member of the public, I have a right to access these records to gain a better understanding of the incident and to hold law enforcement accountable.

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint. The failure to comply with FOIL is a serious matter and can result in both criminal and civil penalties. Therefore, I strongly urge you to comply with this request in a timely and complete manner.

Last, I would like to bring to your attention the case law supporting my request:

New York City Administrative Code Section 14-151 (a) requires the New York Police Department to maintain records of all complaints and allegations of police misconduct, including records of investigations and findings.

New York State Committee on Open Government, Advisory Opinion #2016-4 (2016) states that police body-worn camera footage is presumptively available under FOIL.

Matter of Fappiano v. New York City Police Department, 95 A.D.3d 981 (2d Dep't 2012) held that "FOIL represents a strong policy in favor of open government, and its exemptions must be narrowly construed."

New York Times Co. v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 756 F.3d 100, 117 (2d Cir. 2014) (holding that "the public has a vital interest in information regarding the operations of its government" and that the FOIA "embodies the basic principle that an informed citizenry is essential to democracy").

Matter of DaimlerChrysler Corp. v. Spitzer, 7 N.Y.3d 653, 663 (2006) (stating that "FOIL, like FOIA, reflects a strong policy in favor of open government, and its exemptions must be narrowly construed").

Please note that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Records Related to Threats Made Against Senator Dianne Feinstein and Her Husband

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Related to Threats Made Against Senator Dianne Feinstein and Her Husband
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request any and all records related to threats made against Senator Dianne Feinstein and her husband, including but not limited to the following:

Documents, memos, or reports related to threats made against Senator Feinstein and her husband, including those obtained through the use of electronic surveillance (ELSUR) and keystring searches;

Social media posts, comments, or messages related to threats made against Senator Feinstein and her husband;

Follow-up investigations conducted by the FBI or any other law enforcement agency in relation to these threats, including any interagency searches.

To facilitate the search for these records, I suggest using the following keystring search terms:

Dianne Feinstein
Richard Blum
Threats
Harassment
Intimidation
Violence
Assault

Given the potentially large scope of this request, I respectfully request that the FBI provide any responsive records on a rolling basis, as they become available. This will help ensure that I receive responsive records in a timely manner and allow me to more effectively manage and prioritize the review of the records.To the extent that records are withheld or redacted, I ask that you provide the specific legal basis for the withholding or redaction, and that you provide any segregable portions of otherwise exempt records. In addition, I remind you that FOIA requires agencies to produce records in their entirety, even if portions of the records are exempt from disclosure. See, e.g., Bevis v. Department of State, 801 F.2d 1386, 1389 (D.C. Cir. 1986) (stating that an agency must "release all reasonably segregable portions of [the] record").

I also remind you that FOIA requires agencies to disclose records even if they have been deleted or improperly redacted. See, e.g., Payne Enterprises, Inc. v. United States, 837 F.2d 486, 488 (D.C. Cir. 1988) (stating that an agency must "conduct a reasonable search for records, and cannot limit its search to only those records that it believes to be intact").

If any records responsive to this request have been destroyed, deleted, or otherwise disposed of, I ask that you provide the following information:

The date and circumstances of the disposal or destruction;

The name, title, and position of the person who authorized the disposal or destruction;

The name, title, and position of the person or persons responsible for carrying out the disposal or destruction;

The procedures that were followed for disposing of or destroying the records; and

A description of the records that were destroyed or disposed of.

Finally, I remind you that FOIA provides for attorney's fees and litigation costs to be awarded to a prevailing plaintiff. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(E). Therefore, I urge you to comply fully with this request and to respond within the statutory time frame.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Threats Against Governor Kathy Hochul NY State Police and Counter Terrorism Unit

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Threats Against Governor Kathy Hochul NY State Police and Counter Terrorism Unit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to and copies of all documents, emails, and any other information in the possession of the New York State Police and their Counter Terrorism Unit related to threats made against Governor Kathy Hochul, including emails and tips received by the police, electronic surveillance, and any documents or memos related to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), from her Inauguration on August 24, 2021 to the present. This request includes metadata associated with the records, such as author, date, and time of creation.

As a requester, I would like to bring to your attention that it is crucial to read this request carefully and provide the requested information in a complete and accurate manner. Failure to do so may result in legal action, including filing a complaint with the New York State Committee on Open Government or a court of law, in order to compel the production of the requested records.

To ensure that this request is properly processed, I ask that you carefully review the details of this request, including the scope of documents and information being requested, the timeframe for the requested records, and the specific key string searches to be conducted. If any clarification is needed, please do not hesitate to contact me.


Recent reports have indicated that Governor Hochul has received numerous threats of violence and harm since taking office, including on social media platforms such as Twitter. As a concerned citizen and advocate for transparency, I request access to any documents, emails, or other information in the possession of the New York State Police and their Counter Terrorism Unit that relate to these threats, including any information gathered through electronic surveillance or other investigative methods.

To assist in the search for responsive records, I request that the following keystring searches be conducted:

"Kathy Hochul"
"Governor Hochul"
"threats"
"violence"
"harm"
"social media"
"Twitter"

It is important to note that this request includes not only records related to direct threats against Governor Hochul, but also any records related to the New York State Police's response to such threats, including any investigations, protective measures, or communications with other law enforcement agencies or government entities. The Counter Terrorism Unit is included in this request due to their expertise in responding to threats against public officials.

If any portion of this request is denied or exempt from disclosure, please cite the specific exemption and provide an index of the withheld or redacted records, as required by law.

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold or delete responsive documents will be appealed in a court of law. Any such actions may result in legal proceedings to compel the production of the records and any applicable penalties. I also request that any responsive records be provided on a rolling basis, meaning that records should be provided as they become available instead of waiting for all records to be collected before responding to the request.

In support of this request, I refer to the following court cases and legal principles:

Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Public Officers Law Article 6: This law requires the government to provide access to records maintained by government entities.

National Archives and Records Administration v. Favish, 541 U.S. 157 (2004): This case held that FOIA requires agencies to disclose records unless the agency reasonably foresees that disclosure would harm an interest protected by a FOIA exemption.

Newsday LLC v. Empire State Development Corporation, 98 A.D.3d 36, 944 N.Y.S.2d 78 (2d Dept. 2012): This case held that "an agency must identify which exemption(s) it asserts to justify withholding the requested information, and state in a conclusory fashion how the exemption applies to the particular documents or parts thereof."

Matter of Johnson v. N.Y. State Police, 196 A.D.2d 794, 601 N.Y.S.2d 64 (3d Dept. 1993): This case held that "an agency cannot simply deny access to documents or information sought under FOIL by invoking a statutory exemption; rather, the agency has the burden of demonstrating that the exemption applies to the material in question."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan

title: January 6th Insurrection, Pre-Intelligence Knowledge, and Post-Event Analysis

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: January 6th Insurrection, Pre-Intelligence Knowledge, and Post-Event Analysis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of records, documents, and intelligence related to the insurrection at the United States Capitol on January 6, 2021. The events of January 6th were an unprecedented attack on the U.S. Capitol, resulting in multiple deaths, injuries, and significant damage to the Capitol building. This incident has generated significant public interest and raised questions about national security, law enforcement response, and the role of extremist groups in planning and executing the attack.

Specifically, I am interested in the following information:

Pre-intelligence knowledge: Records and communications that detail any information the FBI had prior to January 6, 2021, regarding potential threats, plans, or coordination related to the insurrection.
Planning, coordination, and execution: Records that detail the planning, coordination, and execution of the event.
Investigations and prosecutions: Records related to any investigations and prosecutions that have resulted from the insurrection.
Post-event information: Records and analysis of the insurrection's impact on national security, law enforcement response, lessons learned, and any related policy changes or recommendations.
Please include any information obtained through cross-references, ELSUR (Electronic Surveillance) records, and interagency communications. Additionally, I request a search for records containing the following keywords: "January 6th," "Capitol," "insurrection," "riot," "protest," "QAnon," "Proud Boys," "Oath Keepers," and any other terms relevant to the event.

The FOIA statute and subsequent case law support the public's right to access these records. In Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989), the Supreme Court recognized that the purpose of the FOIA is to "open agency action to the light of public scrutiny." Furthermore, in Environmental Protection Agency v. Mink, 410 U.S. 73 (1973), the Court emphasized that FOIA "mandates a policy of broad disclosure of government documents."

If any portion of this request is denied or exempt from disclosure, please cite the specific exemption and provide an index of the withheld or redacted records, as required by law. Be advised that any attempt to withhold, destroy, or redact information without proper justification may result in legal action to enforce compliance with the FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan

title: FB Training

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: FB Training
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the event posted on Facebook Page - Veterinarian Forensics Training Webinar for Law Enforcement. The Webinar was open to the public and was presented on December 7th, 2020 at 1PM EST and was sponsored by the Allegheny County District Attorneys Office.

I would also like to know who the presenter was for this Webinar.

The listed itinerary is as follows:   
- Crime scene analysis and documentation
- Evidence recognition – animal vs. human cases
- Key steps for the investigator
- Crime scene considerations for different types of cruelty
- Application of forensics

The link for the Facebook Page that advertises this is:  https://www.facebook.com/events/2612374205720398?active_tab=about

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Val Martin
